event.title: Located on the Zumbro River's south fork, the city has a population of 106,769 according to the 2010

data.event: Located on the Zumbro River's south fork, the city has a population of 106,769 according to the 2010 United States Census.
The U.S. Census Bureau estimated that the 2014 population was 111,402.
In 1863, Dr. William W. Mayo arrived as the examining surgeon for draftees in the Civil War.
On August 21, 1883, the Great Tornado demolished much of Rochester, leaving 37 dead and about 200 injured.

event.title: opened a new facility named St. Marys Hospital in 1889

data.event: Donations of $60,000 were collected and the Sisters of St. Francis, assisted by Mayo, opened a new facility named St. Marys Hospital in 1889.
The Mayo practice grew and is today among the largest and most well-respected medical facilities in the world.
